title: Tenant Deposit Rights (General)
text: A tenant is entitled to the refund of the security deposit at the end of tenancy if there is no damage beyond normal wear and tear. Landlords must provide an itemized deduction statement if they withhold any amount. For tenancy disputes, approach the local Rent Controller office.

title: Consumer Right - Refund for Defective Goods
text: If a product is found defective, the consumer has a right to seek replacement or refund under the Consumer Protection Act. They may approach the district consumer forum with evidence and purchase proof. National Consumer Helpline: 1800-11-4000.

title: IT Act - Cyber Fraud Guidance
text: Fraudulent transactions using computers or mobile devices may constitute offences under the IT Act. Victims should retain transaction logs and file an FIR at the nearest police station and a complaint with the cyber cell. National Cyber Crime Helpline: 1930.

title: Delayed Salary - Labour Law
text: Employers must pay wages on time, before the 7th or 10th of the following month depending on establishment size. If salary is not paid, employees can file a claim with the Labour Commissioner or approach the Labour Court. Labour Helpline: 155214.

title: Minimum Wages
text: Workers are entitled to wages not less than government-fixed minimum rates. Complaints about underpayment can be filed with the Labour Commissioner. Labour Helpline: 155214.

title: Right to Information
text: Any citizen may file an RTI application to seek information from government departments. Applications can be submitted in writing, online, or via post, and departments must respond within 30 days. RTI Online Portal: https://rtionline.gov.in/

title: Domestic Violence Protection
source: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005
text: Victims of domestic violence can seek protection orders, residence orders, and monetary relief by approaching the Magistrate. Free legal aid is available through District Legal Services Authorities. Women Helpline (24x7): 181.

title: Dowry Prohibition
text: Giving or taking dowry is a punishable offence. Complaints can be made to the police or Womenâ€™s Cell. Dowry harassment may also be prosecuted under Section 498A IPC. Police Women Helpline: 1091.

title: Marriage and Divorce
text: Either spouse may file for divorce on grounds such as cruelty, desertion, or mutual consent. A petition must be filed in family court with proper documents and witnesses. Legal Services Authority helpline: 1516.

title: Child Labour
text: Employment of children below 14 years in hazardous occupations is prohibited. Violations can be reported to the Labour Department or Childline. Childline emergency helpline: 1098.

title: Sexual Harassment at Workplace
text: Every workplace with more than 10 employees must have an Internal Complaints Committee. Victims can file a complaint within 3 months of the incident. Non-compliance can be penalized. Women Helpline: 181.

title: SC/ST Atrocities Protection
text: Any act of caste-based violence, humiliation, or discrimination is punishable under this Act. Victims can approach the police and demand FIR registration under relevant SC/ST sections. SC/ST Helpline: 1800-1800-214.

title: Lok Adalat - Free Dispute Resolution
text: Lok Adalats provide free and speedy settlement of disputes like family conflicts, property issues, and cheque bounce cases. Awards passed are binding and enforceable. For details, contact State/District Legal Services Authority. Helpline: 1516.

title: Emergency Helplines (India)
text: Police: 100 | Ambulance: 108 | Fire: 101 | Women Helpline: 181 | Childline: 1098 | Cybercrime: 1930 | Consumer Helpline: 1800-11-4000 | Labour Helpline: 155214 | Legal Aid: 1516 | SC/ST Protection: 1800-1800-214.
